column4: way OT, but not sure where to go: OO for win, how do I tell it to associate itself with .doc after MSword took it over?
you mean inside Windows?
- correct
run OOo's install program again, pick the "Repair Install" option. it'll display the option to take over the Office docs again
- good plan.  thanks
it's the fact that you have to pay MS for the NTFS drivers that make the whole NTFS-writer app non-Free...
- right, but you wouldn't have NTFS in the first place if you didnt' already own the MS product.  the part that is "captive ntfs" is free, open, all that
right, but the whole thing isn't, and people who don't run Win might still be interested in NTFS-writing (can't imagine why, but...)
- I think you are thinking that the captive package includes the MS drivers.  "it" (what you get when you dl captive) doesn't, so "it" can be called free
even if it doesn't include the drivers, it depends on them, and they're not free...
- ext2 depens on things you have to buy to.  but ext2 is free, right?
hardware isn't the issuet, if you mean "you have to own a hard drive to be able to use EXT2"...
http://www.debian.org/intro/free
- find me something that sugests that depandancy on non free drivers voids the OSness of it.
read the URL I just posted...
- like "While free software is not totally free of constraints" or is there something that supports your point?
the "free to develop" part, and "free to copy"
let's move to #ubuntu-offtopic if you want to continue, OK?
#ubuntu-offtopic - you're missing a couple of details that're important...
2005-09-07T11:33:00.000Z	CarlFK	Madpilot	I" dont' care.  if anyone does care, they can go get them
see above ^^^
XPlane is non-free
